td.content: s:a white F aged 61 ys presents with progressive severe sudden drinking of large quantities of alcohol and gambling savings away while playing poker with friends, was formerly reserved, quiet, severe strange behavior and Mental Health for past 9 days. she denies smoking describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 4 years in her past o:Height 63 in, Weight 120 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, Urine toxicology cocaine (-), PCP (+),TCAs serum concenteration (-) a:Bipolar p:administered ZYPREXA - 10 mg at bedtime, performed Urine toxicology, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: friends , was formerly reserved , quiet , severe

td.content: s:pt presents with critical heartburn for 3 days. patient also reports critical chest pain. she is a 61 YO F neurologist. o:Height 63 in, Weight 120 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, Abdomen = tender epigastric region, distended, BS (+), Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Severe Indigestion p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to gastroenterology.

s:pt presents with critical chest pain, Stomach. she has history of critical heartburn. she is a 61 year old female neurologist. Patient does not smoke she drinks 2 beers per night o:Height 63 in, Weight 118 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, Abdomen = tender epigastric region, distended, BS (+), Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Severe Indigestion p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed ranitidine - 150 mg 2 x day, and ordered esophagectomy - esophagus.

s:pt presents with 5 days history of severe sudden drinking of large quantities of alcohol and gambling savings away while playing poker with friends, was formerly reserved, quiet. pt also reports severe strange behavior. she is a female aged 62 Ys. o:Height 62 in, Weight 116 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 16 a:Bipolar p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to psychiatry.

td.content: s:patient presents with increased critical chest pain and critical heartburn over 10 months. pt is a white female neurologist aged 62 yrs. she does not smoke describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 4 years in her past o:Height 64 in, Weight 121 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 18, 24-hour pH monitoring (esophageal) 3.6, Abdomen = tender epigastric region, distended, BS (+), Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Severe Indigestion p:administered ranitidine - 150 mg 2 x day, performed 24-hour pH monitoring (esophageal), and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
